Posts.Content: Hi...I can't comment re chemo and surgery but I had surgery 4th Feb and have started Rads this week so that's 5 weeks.  It is a waiting game I'd check with your Oncologist re flying.  My surgeon told me I could fly but only after all my treatment finishes. Good Luck
Posts.Title: Nearly done with Chemo

Posts.Content: Hi.... The journey we are all on is not an easy one but in my experience I went into survival mode and that was my way of coping. My tumour was picked up in a routine mammogram and they say I'd had it for around 6 months with no symptoms whatsoever. Due to finding it early I was lucky enough not to have chemo so I had WLI and Sentinal node biopsy followed by 15 sessions of Radiotherapy and Hornone treatment for 5 years. The burning and pains you are having will be trauma from the surgery nerve endings being cut and with time it will ease. Good luck with your appointment next week and whatever they throw at you, you will get through . I found being open and honest with my family as to how I was and am feeling was best for me. Good luck xx
Posts.Title: Im newby here

Posts.Content: Hi....I’ve been taking Anastrazole for 21months and had pretty bad side effects. I am recently diagnosed with Osteopenia through taking them. I decided to stop and saw my GP this week who strongly advised me to stay on them as they are the best for my type of cancer!! Totally understand where you are coming from, it’s a nightmare.  Good Luck whatever you decide Maggie
Posts.Title: Stopping Anastrazole early - advice please

Posts.Content: Hi...I haven't heard of the R1 R2 I've had my 13th rads today and only use Aqua Max which they gave to me on day 1. I had my last review today and was told only to use AM and nothing else. My skin is looking sun tanned but not sore on top.when they examined me today I was told not to use anything underneath my breast as it has become red so I was given 2x7 day dressings they use for radiotherapy blistering as a precaution.  I am preparing myself in case I do blister !!
Posts.Title: R1 and R2 treatments for skin damage caused by radiotherapy

Posts.Content: Today I had my first Mammogram since my diagnosis and surgery.  it was painful but had to be done. results day on Friday. Anyone else having their 1st Anniversary ?
Posts.Title: One Year On !!

Posts.Content: Hi...I am experiencing blisters at the moment and I was given burn dressings by the radiologists. One dressing lasts 7 days. It can be taken of to shower then straight back on and it doesn't move. They are really very good. Your GP should be able to order some for you. Maggie 3
Posts.Title: After radiotherapy

Posts.Content: Hi sorry for late reply but we've had no broadband for days ! I would say you do have a right to an MRI under the circumstances, there's no harm in asking. I went yesterday for my 1st hear checkup only to find the mammogram results hadn't come back so it was awaited journey. The surgeon wasn't happy and neither were we . He said I will get a phone call from my breat nurse next week which I don't think is good enough . good luck with your check up and MRI xx
Posts.Title: One Year On !!

Posts.Content: Sorry for late reply but we've had broadband issues. My surgery was 1 year today and I told the surgeon yesterday that I am still very tender and he says it's the rads ! My skin texture is definitely different . When I got there my mammogram results weren't back so I had a wasted journey. Utter shambles after working myself up to hearing what the result was.  I'm now getting a phone call from the breast nurse sometime next week . Good luck for yours next week xx
Posts.Title: One Year On !!

Posts.Content: Hi Maggs Sorry you find yourself in this position having to make such a choice.  I have been taking Anastrazole since early February 2016. I was fine until September 2016 then the pain started. I rang BCN who said I would have to come off it if I couldn't sort pain relief out. I wanted to persevere with Anastrazole so I take co-codamol morning and before bed and it seems to work. hope you get yours sorted out . Good Luck xx
Posts.Title: Anastrozole/Letrozole & Joint Pain

Posts.Content: Hi Bippy The decision you are making is a very personal one to which there is no right or wrong. We all find ourselves in uncertain dilemmas as to what to do for the best. I am 15 months post surgery and 12 months post rads and still coping with the after effects. My Surgeon prescribed Anastrozole Accord brand  as my hormone treatment which I've been taking for 14 months the side effects have subsided except for the  joint pain which I take low dose pain killers for. I intend to carry on taking them to give myself the best chance I can. good luck with your rads and for the future keep fighting x
Posts.Title: Declining further treatment after breast surgery

Posts.Content: Hi Lumie I didn’t have any signs of a lump and  I felt perfectly fine. My cancer was a Grade 2 invasive tumour and they told me I had had it for approx 6 months but it was deep inside my breast so I wouldn’t have found a lump. I have learned so much along this journey. I hope this week passes quickly for you, try and stay positive. Maggie
Posts.Title: Recalled, Waiting, Worried

Posts.Content: Hi lumie  I had been told several years ago I had 2 cysts in my right Breast but they wouldn’t be removing them. Then in 2016 following a routine mammogram and recall they found a tumour. I had no symptoms other than the discomfort I’d always had with the cysts. It is best to be sure although it is a worrying time. Hopefully all will be well when you see them.  There are lots of people here in similar situations so there is always someone to talk to. I hope you dont have to wait long and I wish you the best of luck ...xx
Posts.Title: Recalled, Waiting, Worried

Posts.Content: Hi...first of all my very best wishes are with you tomorrow. I have a grade 2 invasive Mucinous ductal cancer which fortunately hasn't spread to my lymph nodes. We all enter this unknown territory not knowing which way to turn. I take each day as it comes and I am being well looked after by my team.  I had my first radio therapy today which was daunting but ok. We are stronger than we think and we are allowed down days but we need to stay positive too. Good Luck for tomorrow xx
Posts.Title: Results tomorrow

Posts.Content: Hi....I am 2 weeks post radiotherapy and have blisters underneath my breast. This week is also brick wall week. My surgeon told me I could fly anytime after my treatment ended. I wouldn't personally go abroad yet as I am still cooking and I would prefer to be in UK just in case. It's a dilemma for you but I would air on the side of caution. I know feeling the way I do I'm not ready to travel yet.  My radiotherapy started 4 weeks after surgery. Good Luck whatever you decide to do X
Posts.Title: Delaying radiotherapy for a few weeks - could it be detrimental?

Posts.Content: Hi..one day 1 of my rads I was given Aqua Max cream I'm now on day 4 and use it day and night..early days yet but so far  I've been ok.  Has anyone had stinging pain in their breast after rads ?  Maggie 3
Posts.Title: Advice for radiotherapy burns

Posts.Content: Hi...I've had my 6th rads today plus a floor clinic..my breast is aching and painful so they told me that the radiation is inflaming my breast inside and that's what's causing it.  We have to keep going though ..Good Luck xx
Posts.Title: Advice for radiotherapy burns

Posts.Content: Hi...Firstly God Luck for tomorrow !! And so sorry to hear your sad news .  I was diagnosed in Jan 2016 and I remember going for my core biopsy results it’s scary. At least tomorrow you will know one way or the other.  I really hope it’s good news for you. This site is amazing with everyone here very friendly and informative. None of us ever thought we would be here. Please pop in and tell us how you get on. Stay positive xx
Posts.Title: Aches across collar bone and shoulder - biopsy results tomorrow

Posts.Content: Fantastic news Yvonne !! Onwards and upwards now ... I'm just back from day 2 of RT or zapping as I seem to be calling it 13 more to go .. Take care xx
Posts.Title: Good news on results

Posts.Content: Hi.. I've started radiotherapy today and was told  not to use any body lotion they gave me a tube of Aqua Max to use on the skin to help the drying of the skin . no deodorant either unless it's picrok or bionsin. I got mine in boots .. Good Luck
Posts.Title: Body lotion

Posts.Content: Hi...I'm taking Anastrazole brand name Accord and I've had terrible trouble gettingthe brand.  It's down to the cost I've been told but my GP has stated that I must be given this brand. The side effects are bad enough without making it worse.  having said that my side effects have improved loads over the year.  I've been taking them for a year. Good Luck x
Posts.Title: Does a change in brand of tamoxifen make any difference please?
